News.Heading: Mithun Chakraborty surrenders Rs 1.2cr received from Saradha to ED
News.text: KOLKATA: Trinamool Congress MP and actor Mithun Chakraborty on Tuesday surrendered to Enforcement Directorate (ED) an amount of about Rs 1.2 crore that he had received from scam-hit Saradha group of companies for being its brand ambassador. Sources said a team of lawyers and other representatives of the actor reached the probe agency's office at Salt Lake here and handed over a Demand Draft (DD) to the investigating officer (IO) of the case. "This was part of Chakraborty's earlier commitment that he would return the funds that he had received from the group. The DD has been given to the IO of the Saradha scam probe case," sources said. READ ALSO: Saradha scam: ED issues fresh summons to Mithun Chakraborty They added that the agency is satisfied with the said action and the statement recorded by the actor-politician regarding his role in the operations of the group, which has now become defunct in the wake of allegations against it of perpetrating a large-scale chit-fund scam in West Bengal and other states. During his last questioning by ED here in May, Chakraborty had provided the agency sleuths with a number of DVDs, CDs and scripts that he had got as part of being the brand ambassador of the Saradha group. The actor had done so to back his claim to investigators that his association with Saradha Group was "purely professional" and that he had no intentions of cheating or duping anyone. "He had told investigators that he had no inkling about any sort of scam that was being perpetrated. The actor had submitted all his personal and official records to the agency in this regard," the sources said. Chakraborty had also promised he would deposit the amount of Rs 1.2 crore he had received from Saradha Group so that it may be finally restored to the depositors who were allegedly cheated in the scam. The Rajya Sabha MP of the ruling party in West Bengal had told ED that he "actually acted in promotional videos and advertisements that were broadcast on television shows" made by the Saradha Group and that was done as per his contract. He told investigators that if he had bad intentions, he would not have undertaken the promotional activity and instead merely stashed the money away. The probe agency had in June last year questioned the actor in Mumbai after it detected that some money had gone into his account from Saradha business portals. ED subsequently summoned him again early this year following which the latest submissions happened. While recording his statement last year, sources said Chakraborty had told investigators that he had "no business dealings" with the now-defunct group which was headed by Sudipta Sen and that he would share all personal transaction details with them. ED sources had earlier said Chakraborty was reportedly sent the said amount for being the brand ambassador of a media platform floated by Saradha Group. The agency had registered a criminal case under PMLA in 2013 and has already questioned a number of people, including sitting MPs and political leaders, in this regard. The agency, till now, has found that a maze of 338 bank accounts and 224 companies were used by the perpetrators of the alleged ponzi scam which duped investors in various states including West Bengal, Odisha and Assam. CBI, probing the case on the directions of Supreme Court, has also filed a chargesheet in a court.
News.Heading: I had a good time in Vadodara: Vijender Singh
News.text: The team of the film 'Fugly', which will hit the screens soon, was recently in Vadodara for a promotional trip and India's Olympic medal winning boxer Vijender Singh,who is making his Bollywood debut with this film, says that he had a great time. Says Vijender, "It is always good to come to Gujarat. Gujaratis are wonderful people and I love the language too, which is very sweet. I was impressed by the facilities at the city-based Gold's Gym and also had a fun experience at the Parul Institute. Overall, I really enjoyed my Vadodara trip."
News.Heading: Madras high court stays release of Vikram-starrer 'I'
News.text: CHENNAI: The Madras high court on Thursday stayed the release of multi-crore film 'I', dealing a big blow to Tamil film industry which is still to recover from the commercial failure of Rajinikanth-starrer 'Lingaa'. 'I', featuring Vikram and Amy Jackson and directed by Shankar, was scheduled for release on the Pongal day, January 15. Justice R Mahadevan granted the interim injunction, restraining Aascar Films Private Limited, its directors V Ravichandran and D Ramesh Babu, besides Reliance Mediaworks Ltd, from releasing the film till January 30. The producers, distributors, film laboratories and digital projection services are "hereby restrained by an order of interim injunction till January 30, 2015 from releasing the movie in theatres all over the country, and in any country outside India. In the meanwhile, applicant (Picutrehouse) is directed to initiate arbitration proceedings," the judge said. The judge was passing orders on an application filed by Picturehouse Media Limited, Chetpet, claiming non-performance of commercial and financial agreements between it and Aascar Films. It wanted the matter to be settled by arbitration. While restraining all concerned from releasing the film in any format till January 30, Justice Mahadevan asked the litigating parties to settle the issue by arbitration in the meanwhile. He issued notices to the producers and directed them to file their response by then.
News.Heading: Pawan Kalyan returns as 'Sardaar Gabbar Singh'
News.text: Telugu superstar Pawan Kalyan is set to enthrall viewers with 'Sardaar Gabbar Singh'. Helmed by KS Ravindra, the action-packed entertainer will release in Hindi and Telugu next month. The film, which is a sequel of the 2012 hit 'Gabbar Singh,' sees Pawan play a cop and pair up with Kajal Aggarwal for the first time. Its teaser that was launched last week has got a good response online. Sunil Lulla, MD, Eros International, which is releasing the Hindi version, says, "This highly stylised action-packed film, starring one of our biggest stars, promises universal appeal that will resonate with the audience in Northern markets as well." The actor adds, "We've attempted to make a film that will have a unique connect with India, especially the Hindi belt." Producer Sharrath Marar sums it up, "There are huge expectations from Tollywood's most anticipated movie and we are confident this will charm Pawan Kalyan's fans and win hearts across the country as well." 'Sardaar Gabbar Singh,' released by Eros International in association with Pawan Kalyan Creative Works and Northstar Entertainment, releases on April 8.
News.Heading: A perfect sundowner to end the weekend in Hyderabad
News.text: Those Hyderabadis who love their deep house and trance could not have found a better way to bid aideu to their weekend. The city played host to a sundowner featuring electronic music artistes like Darlyn Vlys whose music is a fusion of French and Spanish influences. As Darlyn spun his tunes, the crowd shot back at him with loud cheers. A special cocktail did the rounds which the guests enjoyed.
News.Heading: Allari Naresh gets married to Virupa
News.text: Allari Naresh tied the knot with Chennai-based architect Virupa at 10 pm on Friday night, amidst beats of mridangam and nadaswaram. Post the thaali kattu ceremony, it was all fun and games, as the newlyweds were seen in their element during the 'talambralu', even as friends and family cheered them on. And almost four hours later, in the post-nupital ceremony where the bride and the groom vie with each other to retrieve a ring dropped in a pot, Allari Naresh had the last laugh. "Both of them played the game very seriously. While Naresh won the first two rounds, Virupa got the ring in the final round... We had so much fun cheering for them," said actor Nani's wife, Anjana, who's a close friend of Naresh. "It's truly a match made in heaven..." "The couple just can't stop blushing..." "They look very much in love..." "They look perfect for each other..." these were just some of the comments overheard as Naresh and Virupa posed for pictures, took selfies with their friends and greeted their guests. The ceremony came to an end around midnight, soon after Allari Naresh took Virupa outside to show her the 'Arundhati nakshatram'. When Chandrababu Naidu stopped the show, literally... An hour into the ceremony, when Andhra CM, Nara Chandrababu Naidu walked in, along with son Lokesh, the rituals at the mandap had to be paused for few moments to felicitate a quick photo session with the couple. By then, both Naresh and Virupa were seated on either side of the curtain that separates the groom and the bride until the muhurtam; however, the couple made an exception for the chief minister and got up from their seats. And as soon as Chandrababu Naidu left the stage, the rituals proceeded without any further interruption. Later, CBN was seen spending some time mingling with guests at the venue, during which Naresh's elder brother Rajesh introduced his son, Aarav to him. The usually reticent CBN, who's just become a grandfather himself, seemed to be in an indulgent mood as he interacted with the tots who gathered around him. Cell phone-wielding young fans kept celebs on their toes Almost all the celebrities who graced the ceremony were kept busy by kids and youngsters who flocked to them for selfies. As long as there were no bodyguards around, the kids didn't let even a single celebrity go without posing for a selfie! From the wedding hall, to the mandap and even the food counters outside the young uns were everywhere, ready with their phone cameras and selfie faces!
News.Heading: Veteran Gujarati actress Padmarani passes away
News.text: Gujarati actress, stage artist and sister of popular actress, Sarita Joshi, Padmarani, passed away at a private hospital in Mumbai today, 25 January 2016. Incidentally, today also happens to be her 79th birth anniversary. Padmarani was admitted to Wockhardt Hospital in Mumbai following complications in her lungs caused by a viral fever. Padmarani was born to a Marathi family in Pune and spent most of her adulthood in Vadodara. The veteran actor acted in a series of Gujarati films and went on to act in some Bollywood movies too. Some of the popular plays in which she was the lead are 'Baa Retire Thai Chhe,' 'Baa A Maari Boundary,' 'Kevda Na Dankh,' 'Saptapadi,' 'Chandarwo,' '5 Star Aunty,' 'Vachan,' among others. She has also acted in several renowned Hindi movies including Parivar (1968), Veer Ghatotkach (1970), Jai Santoshi Maa (1975), Dil (1990) as Aamir Khan's mother and Zaalim (1994). Our condolences go out to her family. May her soul rest in peace. Read this story in Gujarati: ??????? ???????? ?????? ????????? ???????????? ????
News.Heading: Bhoomi, Samir, Mana bond over music
News.text: When an exceptionally good singer meets with two brillaintly talented musicians, you know it is bound to lead to some musical fireworks. Recently, Bhoomi Trivedi, who is currently recording a lot of songs for Samir-Mana for a couple of different films, was in their studio, recording for a movie titled Matsar. But their bond is so special that not only did she record the song, the three of them also bonded over a cool jam session for hours. Says Mana Raval, "We have worked with Bhoomi on a lot of projects in the recent past and so it has become very easy for us to bond over music. She's a wonderful girl. We were all a little free after the recording got done surprisingly fast and so went on to do a little singing and music session."
News.Heading: Kishore roped in for Kamal Haasans next
News.text: Kishore, who was last seen in the Tamil film Thilagar, has been roped in for Kamal Haasan's next, Thoongavanam. Confirming this, the actor told us, "I have a key role in the movie and my character will be introduced in the beginning itself. I can't reveal much about my role as it is being kept secret." Apart from Kamal, the action-thriller also has Trisha and Prakash Raj in prominent roles. Kishore is looking forward to working with Kamal, who he thinks is a "meticulous actor". "He comes with loads of experience and there is no one like him. I was just a spectator during the discussions that we had about the movie," he says. Kishore is currently busy shooting for Tund Haikal Sahavasa and is expected to join the cast of Thoongavanam in Hyderabad soon. He will shoot for the Tamil movie for the next two months.
News.Heading: Bas Ek Chance is an urban Gujarati film: Kirtan Patel
News.text: Well begun, they say, is half the job done. Vadodara boy Kirtan Patel, who will start shooting for his first Dhollywood film titled 'Bas Ek Chance' soon, has already put together an impressive cast (including the likes of veteran actors Rajeev Mehta and Falguni Dave) and says that his story will appeal to the audience. Kirtan shares, "Ours is a very urban film, which everyone will relate to. It is the story of an aspiring filmmaker, who overcomes many struggles in life and eventually achieves his dream. It's time that we told relevant stories in Gujarati films and I firmly believe that Gujarati films are changing for the better." The film, which will be shot in and around Vadodara, has Bhakti Kubavat and Aditya Kapadia in lead roles.
News.Heading: Simhaa will be seen in an action avatar in his next
News.text: Although Bobby Simhaa already has a slew of films like Urumeen, Paambu Sattai, Masala Padam, Bangalore Days remake and Ko2 underway, the actor has signed his next film. We hear that the actor will be teaming up with debutant director Vijay Vaanan for an out-and-out action film. A source close to the actor says, "Simhaa will be seen in an action avatar in this upcoming film. After Jigarthanda, he has been getting a lot of offers similar to the role of Sethu, that he had played in the film. But, he was not too keen on taking them up as he wanted to work on different genres. Now, after working on an interesting line up of films like Urumeen and the Bangalore Days remake, he has decided to take up this action film. He will start shooting for this yet-to-be-titled film from September."
News.Heading: Sibi Malayil has a surprise bday bash
News.text: Veteran director Sibi Malayil had a major surprise in store for him while attending the audio launch of Unni Mukundan-starrer 'Oru Murai Vanthu Parthaya'. The director was surprised by the cast and crew, who had arranged for a cake-cutting ceremony. A crowd had gathered for the audio launch held in Kochi recently. The event also had Unni Mukundan and Prayaga Martin in attendance, apart from its director Sajan K Mathew. The movie has Unni playing an electrician and revolves around a triangle love story featuring Sanusha, Prayaga and his character.
News.Heading: Luxury car's magical March in Gujarat
News.text: Good services bring in great response. And this is exactly what happened with Nixynova Motoren Pvt. Ltd., the dealers for the luxury car brand Audi in Gujarat (they have dealership at Ahmedabad, Vadodara, Surat and Rajkot), who witnessed a groundbreaking response from their patrons bringing more smiles to their team. They couldn't have asked for a better gift from their patrons before ushering in the new financial year as they had record-breaking sales figures this March and registered a growth of more than 78% as compared to last year. This amazing success story hardly comes as a surprise though. After all, Audi has emerged as one of the most powerful, trusted and accepted brands in the state in the luxury car segment. Audi has always been the pioneers when it comes to introducing new technology and their great innovations and much sought-after products have always mesmerized their audience. The all new Audi Q7 and the Audi A6 Matrix were the big tickets that helped in ensuring a stellar performance. Speaking to us on this joyous occasion, Jainit Mistry, Director Sales and Marketing, Nixynova Motoren Pvt. Ltd., said, "We at Audi are very happy to retain our position in the luxury car market. This demonstrates the strength of brand Audi in the market. The audience today is amplified by younger participants with an interest in sport and exotic cars." So, it's time for some real celebrations.
News.Heading: Sai's rendezvous with Aamir Khan
News.text: Actress Sai Tamhankar is on a roll these days. Also read: Sai Tamhankar bags international project The actress impressed everyone with her performance in the Hindi film 'Hunterrr' and even bagged a role in the Indo-American film 'Love Sonia' where she will feature with actors like Manoj Bajpayee, Anupam Kher, Frieda Pinto and Adil Hussain. Very recently, she was seen with Aamir Khan at Amravati. Sai, Sunil Barve and Reema along with Aamir indulged in sharamdaan (social work) at Amravati recently. The pretty actress even clicked a selfie with Mr Perfectionist and needless to say, her smile from ear-to-ear sums up her feeling. Sai Tamhankar: Trendsetter of Marathi film industry 02:16
News.Heading: 'Chandi Kori' team all geared up for 100 days bash on Jan 4
News.text: Bolli Movies' Tulu film 'Chandi Kori' that broke-even in 52 days of its release clocked its 100th day on January 2. Enthused by people's continued patronage to his film, director-actor Devdas Kapikad and the entire Bolli Movies team is all set to celebrate this occasion, that a handful of the 60-odd Tulu films released to date have achieved, with a bash scheduled to be held at Town Hall on Monday. All stakeholders of the film will be honoured on this occasion. Devdas told reporters here that the film has been running successfully in Kalpana theatre in Udupi, Suchitra talkies and Big Cinemas in the city for the past 100-days. "Suchitra theatre has been lucky for the production team in that it has helped buck a trend for Tulu films that only those Tulu films released at Jyothi theatre rake in the moolah," he said, adding that the box office at Suchitra had returned record breaking collection thus far with average daily collection of Rs 1 lakh. The film running for 100-days in Kalpana too is a record in that it is the first Tulu film to do so for any theatre in Udupi, he said, adding that Chandrashekar Holla, the exhibitor has confirmed that 68,000 patrons have watched the film in the last 100-days there. "'Chandi Kori' has broken the collection that hit Kannada films such as Mungaru Male and Yajamana brought for Kalpana," he said adding these are good, encouraging signs for the fledgling Tulu film industry. With the film attracting viewers in steady numbers at Big Cinemas even now, 'Chandi Kori' even achieved a record of touching 50-days in a suburban theatre Nataraj at Surathkal, he said. "No Kannada film has achieved this feat in Surathkal," he said adding even though Mangaluru is just 30-minute drive away, people in and around Surathkal have patronized the film in large numbers. This has spurred Bolli Movies to plan its next venture Barsa on a bigger scale, he noted. Incidentally, 'Chandi Kori' has not just been Tulu speaking districts phenomenon. Buttressing this, Devdas said, "A recent screening of the film in London attracted 175 viewers and plans are afoot to organize a second one for those who missed it." Film has been screened in Kuwait, Bahrain, and plans afoot to do so in Dubai, Qatar, Muscat and Australia. Film has done well even in Mumbai despite the limited screens available due to the Marathi first policy there, he said. News.Heading: I am a clown in real life: Ashwin Kumar
News.text: Those who watched Nivin Pauly-starrer Jacobinte Swargarajyam would have noticed a new face among the lead stars, the deep-voiced, formidable looking businessman named Murali Menon who poses a threat to the family in the film. The actor who played the role, Ashwin Kumar, is a well-known mimicry artiste and short film actor, and this is his first role in a full-fledged feature film. Interestingly, Ashwin too is a Dubai-based businessman in real life but he says he is nothing like Murali Menon. "I'm a clown actually, my parents often ask me to start getting serious about life." But this young man is quite serious about cinema, and says the role in Jacobinte Swargarajyam was a dream-come-true for him. "I have to thank director Vineeth Sreenivasan for that, for casting a debutant like me for the character. It was meant to be done by none other than Gautham Menon." So how did he bag the role? "Well, destiny and luck, I would say," says Ashwin. "I was supposed to do just a small role, and I was about to fly to India to attend a very close friend's wedding. At that point, Vineethettan told me, 'Gautham Menon won't be able to come to Dubai as all flights from Chennai are cancelled due to the floods'. I felt bad as I wouldn't be able to meet Gautham, but was wondering why Vineeth was telling me all this. And then he just told me, 'I want you to do the role'. I went numb for a moment," he recalls. "I was in two minds as I couldn't miss my friend's wedding but then, it was Vineeth Sreenivasan who was inviting me. Later that day I found that my flight too had been cancelled owing to the floods. So I won't say I thank the Chennai floods as it was a very unfortunate disaster but it did play a part in my career." Watching Ashwin on screen, one wouldn't think he is a debutant, but the youngster says his experience in short films and stage performances have definitely helped. "I have been acting in short films for seven years and have even directed one. I had no contacts in films, and was in Dubai. All I had was my friends who always encouraged me." What with his mimicry skills, would he do comedy next? "I would love to! But I don't believe in branding roles, all I want to do is situational roles; how people are like in real life." So what is he planning on next? "I'm the heir to the throne to my dad's business; it's our bread and butter, and I have to be here in Dubai. But I hope to strike a decent balance between business and cinema."
News.Heading: Hogi Pyar Ki Jeet goes on floors
News.text: The shoot of Khesari Lal Yadav's upcoming film Hogi Pyar Ki Jeet is currently underway in full swing in Uttar Pradesh's Jaunpur. A major part of the shoot is taking place in and around a famous fort in the city. The film also stars Sweety Chhabda, Avadesh Mishra, Brijesh Tripathi, Anoop Arora, Neha Singh, Pallavi Kohli, Ayaz Khan and others. Hogi Pyar Ki Jeet is produced by Rahul Kapoor, whose recent film Katta Tanal Dupatta Par became a box office success. The film is said to be a family oriented love story. Yadav has also lent his voice for a song in the film. Well-known and veteran Bollywood singer Udit Narayan is also one of the playback singers. Apart from this film, Yadav is also shooting for director Manjul Thakur's yet untitled movie. Source: Bhojpurimedia.com
News.Heading: My entire life revolves around my mom: Tanvi Vyas
News.text: Vadodara girl Tanvi Vyas, who made Gujarat proud by winning the Femina Miss India Earth crown in 2008 and whose recent Telugu film Nenem Chinnapillana got very good reviews, says that she is completely dependent on her mom for almost everything. Shares Tanvi, "I really don't know how to manage things when my mother isn't around, and my entire life revolves around her. I share a great bond with her." Tanvi, who had a good 2013, is eagerly looking forward to a great 2014 too. She says, "2013 was an amazing year, as I got to do something new and exciting almost every month! I hope that things get even better this year."
News.Heading: The only way to survive in this industry is to want to be in it badly
News.text: For someone who shifted from doing a Bachelor's degree in science to doing a Masters in Drama, Shaunak's risk taking abilities are commendable. After doing some plays for college fests he has now acted in many plays including popular hit 'Preet Piyu Ne Panetar' and has also written and directed a number of plays. Shaunak found his calling as a theater artiste in college and made the decision to make his passion into his fulltime profession. "Initially it was slightly confusing, but when I realized that if I don't take this step now, I'd be working as a medical representative somewhere, collecting my salary and going home. Theater gave me a platform and made me a known face, I was not just making money but was also becoming famous. Had I been an MR, I'd never have done something I loved. Right then, the decision became easy." So what about the limited finances that Gujarati theater is known to have? "You must believe in yourself and the power of theater, you should be able to believe that doing plays will get you where you want to be, you will earn money and drive a car and live in a big house. To be able to survive in this industry, you should want to be in it badly. That's the only way I know."
News.Heading: Tamil actor Krishna booked under charges of dowry and harassment
News.text: Tamil cinema actor Krishna has been booked under dowry harassment case by all women police station, Thudiyalur here on Thursday. His wife Hemalatha of Mettupalayam claimed that her husband mistreated, manhandled her. Meanwhile, the actor filed a petition before Madras high court, seeking anticipatory bail. READ: ?'Paayum Puli' release stalled Hemalatha told in her complaint that she befriended the actor on Facebook. Later, they fell in love and got married. On February 6, 2014 the marriage was held at Sri Sai Mahal at Mettupalayam. His family members demanded 300 sovereigns of gold ornaments as dowry. But her family members gave 118 sovereigns and told them that they would provide the rest of the sovereigns later. The couple was living in an apartment at Ashoka avenue at Kodambakkam and later the couple was moved to T Nagar. Hemalatha said that she pursued BE (computer science) and was working for a software firm in Chennai. Initially, Krishna bought her a car to commute to her office while later she was asked to travel in bus. Krishna and his parents Sekar alias Kula Senate, film producer and Madhubala allegedly renewed the demand for 300 sovereigns of gold. But her family was unable to fulfill the demand. Hemalatha reported in her complaint that Krishna has extramarital affairs with a few women. She came to know about them and questioned him. Immediately, she was beaten by Krishna, for which she was later admitted to Malar hospital. Meanwhile, Krishna filed a case for divorce in July 2015. The police received the petition and forwarded it to Social welfare department as the petitioner mentioned that she was harassed in the pretext of dowry. Following the petition, Krishna was asked to appear before the officials of social welfare department and police. But he failed to appear and the police inspector Amudha registered a case against Krishna and his parents on Thursday under sections 498(A), 406, 506(i) of IPC and 4 of dowry prohibition act. News.Heading: Prithviraj to shoot Priyadarshans movie next year
News.text: That Prithviraj and Priyadarshan have teamed up for a movie is by itself a big news that Mollywood audience have longed to hear. We have now got wind of the details that the film, scripted by '1983' scribe Bipin Chandran, will go on floors by next year. Actor Manianpilla Raju, who is part of the film, says, "Priyadarshan had bounced off an idea to Prithviraj and he loved it. They are yet to develop the story as Priyadarshan also has another schedule of 'Oppam' with Mohanlal left. Right after that, he would be doing a Bollywood movie with Akshay Kumar." Raju, who will also be funding the film, says that the film will have a schedule in Sri Lanka. "The plan right now is to begin shooting the movie by January next year," says the actor. When we reached out to Priyadarshan, he said it is too soon to discuss the details of the movie as the script is yet to be completed. Meanwhile, Prithviraj is currently busy with the final schedule of Jeethu Joseph's revenge tale Oozham and will join the sets of debutant Jaykrishnan's 'Ezra' by the end of this month.
News.Heading: What are the collection figures of 10 Endrathukulla and Naanum Rowdy Dhaan?
News.text: Here's the buzz on the box office figures of the two Ayudha pooja releases 10 Endrathukulla and Naanum Rowdy Dhaan. Dhanush has tweeted the first-day collections of his production, the Vijay-Sethupathi-starrer Naanum Rowdy Dhaan. "Naanum Rowdy dhaan opens to a superb 2.16cr day 1 .Highest for Vijay Sethupathi. Expecting a big jump today," he tweeted and gave area-wise break-up of the collections. Meanwhile, there are two versions on the collections of Vikram's 10 Endrathukulla. While some trade analysts are saying that the film has collected to the tune of Rs 6.5 crore, making it the second highest opening day figures for a Vikram film after I, some others are maintaining that the film has collected only Rs 2.91 crores. Now, it is up to the production house behind the film to come out and clarify on the actual figures. But with the film earning mixed reviews, will they?
News.Heading: Its a case of mistaken identity for Jayasurya in next
News.text: Sidharth Bharathan is back in the groove! After making a full recovery from a major car accident in September last year, the actor-director is currently busy finishing the script of his next movie, which will have Jayasurya in the lead. "Jayasurya plays a 36-year-old character named Anil. I can't divulge more about his character right now. Mistaken identity is the basic theme of the movie. It has got comedy; something on the lines of Priyan sir's films," says Sidharth, who had worked as assistant director to Priyadarshan earlier. The filmmaker tells us that though it's a "done-to-death subject", the upcoming movie will have a different take on it. "Even my last film 'Chandrettan Evideya' didn't have a new subject; it was about an extra-marital affair. It's just that our approach was different and that's what worked," he explains. Sidharth adds that he strongly believes in what his late father and veteran director Bharathan had said: 'There are only around 15 basic story subjects which all films revolve around'. So the focus for me is not to come up with a novel subject but to present it in a fresh way." Sidharth has also roped in writer Anand Neelakantan, who has authored books such as Asura - The Tale of the Vanquished, as the co-scriptwriter for the movie. Apart from Jayasurya, the film will have Murali Gopy, Suraj Venjaramoodu and Sidharth's mother KPAC Lalitha. "The rest of the cast is yet to be finalised and we expect to start filming by the end of this year," he informs. The filmmaker says he is also planning to build on the success of 'Chandrettan Evideya'. "The movie gave me an opening to the family audience. While my upcoming movie wouldn't be an out-and-out family entertainer, it would appeal to them as well," says Sidharth.
News.Heading: Jishnu's last movie hits theatres
News.text: Late actor Jishnu's last film 'Traffic' hit theatres on Friday. The movie was directed by late Rajesh Pillai and was a remake of the filmmaker's 2011 Malayalam hit. The movie opened to mostly positive reviews on Friday and had Jishnu essaying the role played by Krishna in the original. The movie was shot in two years ago, based on the adapted screenplay by Suresh Nair. Jishnu had passed away in March after losing his battle with cancer and succumbing to the illness.
News.Heading: Plays need to be marketed better: Anupam Kher
News.text: Anupam Kher, who was in Vadodara recently for the play Kuchh Bhi Ho Sakta Hai, which was staged as a part of VadFest, feels that plays need to be promoted more aggressively in India, just as Bollywood films are. Said Kher, "More than anything else, it's the state of performing arts that best sums up any city and so, it's crucial that all of us support theatre as much as we can. Plays need to be marketed in a better way and it will certainly help if big actors, who go out of their way to promote films, do the same for plays too."
News.Heading: Isha Sharvani dressed to the at the audio launch of Iyobinte Pusthakam, held in Kochi
News.text: The audio launch of Amal Neerad's Iyobinte Pusthakam saw celebs making a beeline for the event. We spotted leading lady, Isha Sharvani, dressed to the T in a white western outfit. However, its lead actor Fahadh Faasil was conspicuous by his absence. The other stars in attendance were Gino, Vinayakan, Chemban Vinod and Salam Bukari among others.
News.Heading: Kamal Haasan's 'Indian' sequel on the cards!
News.text: Producer AM Rathnam says the sequel to critically acclaimed Tamil blockbuster 'Indian' is in the offing. He added that talks with filmmaker Shankar have been initiated, but it is still not sure when the project will go on the floors. "I recently met Shankar and discussed the possibility of a sequel to 'Indian'. Since he's busy with 'Enthiran 2', the project is unlikely to happen soon," said Rathnam. Shankar-directed 'Indian' featured Kamal Haasan in the title role. It was about a man who takes corruption head on. Asked if the sequel will feature Haasan in the lead, Rathnam said: "It's too early to talk about it." AM Rathnam also said he is planning to bag the theatrical version of Shankar's 'Enthiran 2' with superstar Rajinikanth.
News.Heading: Trailer of Yogaraj Bhat's Vaastu Prakara
News.text: Kannada film director Yogaraj Bhat is gearing up for the release of his next - Vaastu Prakara. The film stars Jaggesh, Rakshit Shetty and Parul Yadav among others, and is said to be quite the laugh riot. Being experimental as always, Yogaraj has released a trailer that includes a team of three plus one crazy people at a talk show introducing various aspects of the film in a rather weird way. Check out the trailer to see what we mean. Watch the trailer of Vaastu Prakara here.
News.Heading: Sairat becomes highest grossing Marathi film
News.text: The Marathi film 'Sairat' has continued its golden run into the third week and is breaking records on its way. The film which collected Rs 25.50 cr in the first week of its release, went on to shatter Marathi BO records with a whopping collection of Rs 41.11 cr at the end of 11 days, according to the entertainment website Bollywood Hungama. Also read: Aamir Khan praises 'Sairat' In doing this, the film has surpassed the earnings of 'Natsamrat', 'Lai Bhaari', 'Duniyadari' and 'Balak Palak'. An interesting aspect to note about this collection figure is that it is much more than many Bollywood big ticket releases this year including 'Rocky Handsome' and 'Jai Gangaajal'. Furthermore, this feat has been achieved by the film in much lesser number of screens. While the Bollywood releases were screened across India, 'Sairat' released across Maharashtra and at a few screens in neighbouring states. The film directed by Nagraj Manjule and featuring Akash Thosar as Parshya and Rinku Rajguru as Archi, has been earning rave reviews for its realistic portrayal of a love story and its BO collection has only added to its success. 'Sairat's run at the BO stands to continue for another week due to no Marathi releases. Next week will be a testing time for the film with the Aishwarya Rai Bachchan-Randeep Hooda starrer 'Sarbjit' scheduled to hit screens. WATCH: 'Yad Lagla' from 'Sairat':
News.Heading: 'Captain America: Civil War' gets good start in India
News.text: New Delhi: The superhero team up in "Captain America: Civil War" has struck the right chord at the Indian box office. The film, starring Chris Evans and Robert Downey Jr has minted over Rs.27 crore in its opening weekend. The Disney and Marvel superhero adventure released in India on May 6. According to a statement from the makers, "Captain America: Civil War" collected Rs.9.81 crore on Sunday with a growth of 10 percent over Saturday. The cumulative total so far is Rs.27.13 crore. The collection is on the basis of business of both English as well as Hindi version of "Captain America: Civil War", wherein Bollywood actor Varun Dhawan has voiced the character of Steve Rogers aka Captain America. Directed by Joe and Anthony Russo, the film sees an ideological showdown between Iron Man (played by Downey Jr) and Captain America (Evans) and is packed to the brim with other superheros. Trade guru Taran Adarsh who is impressed with the business of the film tweeted: "'CaptainAmerica: Civil War' Friday Rs 8.53 crore, Saturday Rs 8.79 crore, Sunday Rs 9.81 crore... Total Rs. 27.13 crore nett...Excellent". "Captain America: Civil War" promises the spectacle of watching Captain America square off against Iron Man. It also introduces Tom Holland as Spider-Man and marks the first appearance of Chadwick Boseman as the Black Panther.
News.Heading: Kranti wants to be PeeCee
News.text: Actress Kranti Redkar has turned into an identity thief for her upcoming movie 'Kiran Kulkarni Vs Kiran Kulkarni'. When asked about whose identity she would like to steal in real life, she replied, "I would love to steal the identity of Priyanka Chopra." Kranti is in awe of Piggy Chops' success in Bollywood as well Hollywood. "She is really doing well for herself and I am really happy for her. What she has achieved as an Indian actress is impressive therefore, given a choice, I would like to be her," says Kranti. Also read: Kranti turns stunt-girl for next However, in reality Kranti feels that cyber crime and identity theft are scary issues. "I have experienced these kinds of issues. Someone quoted me when I was not even present at the event and then the whole onus fell onto me. It was really troublesome," she shares. Talking about the film, which also features Subodh Bhave and Mohan Joshi, she adds, "It's great that a film has been done on cyber crime. My character in the film has lot of shades. It was not an easy role to play. You hate my character, you love her, she makes you laugh and within no time she makes you cry as well. The character is irritating at times, and sometimes you feel sympathetic to her. The role was truly demanding." -- Anagha.Pathak@timesgroup.com

News.Heading: Siddharth continues relief work in Cuddalore

News.Heading: Mollywood warms up to films with kids in key roles
News.text: With the schools closed for vacation, it seems that Mollywood has opened the doors for more movies with children playing the pivotal characters. Already three movies are under production with kids in central roles Kunchacko Boban's 'School Bus', an upcoming Sunny Wayn film and Tovino Thomas' 'Guppy'. The latest to join the bandwagon is Kalavoor Ravikumar's 'Kuttikalundu Sookshikuka'. While the movie has Anoop Menon and Bhavana as part of the cast, it's Jo and the Boy star Sanoop Santhosh and Balaganapathy fame Siddharth Ajithkumar who play the central roles. "Their characters set off the plot with a particular incident," Ravikumar says.However, he adds that it is not a children's movie. "While it has its series of fun and feel-good moments, it evolves into a thriller." Of late, Mollywood has had several such films that have schoolchildren as key characters in spite of having superstars such as Mammootty, Nayanthara and Manju Warrier as part of the cast. Here are some such movies: Jo and the Boy The movie was billed as a children's film starring Manju Warrier. But it turned out to be an inspirational film about not giving up on one's dreams, no matter one's age. Sanoop's character provides the inspiration for Manju to accomplish her dream of becoming a renowned animator. Malgudi Days The film was inspired by a real-life incident in Nagaland about two school children, played by Janaki Menon and Vishal Krishna, who get trapped in the school campus. The movie also has Anoop Menon and Bhamaa, but it was the two kids who made the maximum screen time with eight-year-old Janaki winning a State Award for her performance in the movie. Ben The Vipin Atley movie, which was based on true incidents, was about kids but was definitely not a children's film. It told the tale of a mom and son, and how unrealistic expectations take a toll on the child physically and mentally. While Anjali Upasana, who played the mother, won a State Award for her performance, Gaurav Menon as Ben clinched the National and State Awards for the Best Child Artiste. School Bus The film, based on real-life events, is scripted by Bobby-Sanjay duo and directed by Rosshan Andrrews. It also has Kunchacko Boban and Jayasurya as part of the cast. Despite the heavyweights, the movie is told from the point of view of two kids and through them, the audience gets a peek in to the adults' world. The film reportedly is about a child-missing case, which Kunchacko's cop character investigates. Bhaskar the Rascal The movie has two superstars of the South Mammootty and Nayanthara but it was two child artistes who played the key roles in bringing the lead characters together. The former plays a widower while Nayanthara essays an estranged wife. Their children are schoolmates and their friendship leads to their parents becoming close.' Jilebi The movie showcased the clash of lifestyles between Jayasurya's rustic character and his Dubai-bred nephews. The kids played the central role in the movie that emphasised on the fact that one should value relationships over a person's financial status. Guppy The film has Tovino Thomas playing a civil engineer who comes to town to supervise the construction of a bridge. However, the central character is a 14-year-old boy, who makes a living by rearing and selling aquarium fish. Sunny Wayn's upcoming movie The upcoming film has Deiva Thirumagal fame Sarah Arjun playing a six-year-old school kid named Ann Maria. Sunny Wayn will be seen as a rustic youth, who enters her life by accident. How the two influence each other's lives forms the plot of this feel-good movie.
News.Heading: Shivarajkumar's Belli cut by 13 minutes
News.time_cap: Bangalore Mirror Bureau | Nov 7, 2014, 12.06 PM IST
News.text: Shivarajkumar's latest release Belli will be trimmer by 13 minutes from today. The film released last week and was 140 minutes long. The Mussanje Mahesh directed film is now shorter after audience feedback that some of the scenes were not effective due to their length. It is not uncommon for films to be trimmed after release. However, they have to go through the process of getting permission from the Censor Board even for deleting any scene. Recently films like Ninnindale and Ulidavaru Kandante were trimmed after release. Ninnidale lost as much as 18 minutes while Ulidavaru Kandante lost 12 minutes. There were some some exchange of words between Ulidavaru Kandante director Rakshit Shetty and producer Suni with the former accusing of trimming the film without informing the former. But the real trouble was for the film Adyaksha. There were objections to a song in the film about Lord Krishna. The Censor Board, however, did not find anything wrong and allowed the song in full. However bowing to pressure from a caste group, a portion of the song was deleted.
News.Heading: Security heightened at Goa EDM festivals over terror threat
News.text: Security at the electronic dance music (EDM) festivals Sunburn and the Supersonic held annually in Goa, will be heightened in view of a terror threat posed by extremist groups like the Islamic State (IS), Tourism Minister Dilip Parulekar said. ?ALSO READ: Goa govt yet to give nod to 'Sunburn', 'Supersonic' festivals Speaking to IANS on the sidelines of a media event at the state Secretariat on Wednesday, Parulekar also said that permissions for the two events were held in abeyance, until the organisers complied with requests for providing additional security cover."We want the best security in view of the IS threat. The single window permission committee headed by the chief secretary, which grants permission for such events has decided to ask the organisers of the events to increase security on site," Parulekar said. Chief Secretary of Goa, R.K. Srivastava heads the committee which grants single window clearance to major tourism related events organised in the state. Parulekar also said that some of the specific requests which have been made by the committee includes increasing the number of metal detectors at the EDM festival venues and sniffer dogs to keep track of possible explosive substances. "The police will be there, but the organisers will also have to increase the security in view of the threat. The permissions will be granted once they comply with these conditions," Parulekar said. Goa, one of the top beach and nightlife tourism destinations, hosts two of the biggest party events in the country namely Sunburn and Supersonic EDM festival which are held in the last week of December, which coincides with peak tourism season.

News.Heading: Canadian Paula makes her Marathi debut
News.text: Over the past few months we have heard of Marathi filmmakers and actors making it big with international offers. Well, it is understood then that actors and filmmakers from the other side will be happy to be seen in Marathi films too. One such example is Paula McGlynn. Paula, who hails from Vancouver, Canada, will be making her debut in Marathi films with fashion photographer turned filmmaker Prashant Patil's 'Pindadaan'. We speak to her about her journey from Canada to Pune and her future plans. Excerpts from an interview: Why did you choose to make a debut in a Marathi film? I came to India three years ago with an aim to make a career in the film industry. 'Pindadaan' came to me through a friend's friend, who was casting for the film. He thought I would fit the role perfectly. This is how I selected my first film as a lead. For me, it has never been about the language. It has always been about the right character, project and working with the right people. I am immersed in Marathi culture owing to a strong friend's circle and business partners who are Maharashtrians. So, my debut in a Marathi film is obvious. What about your character Ana appealed to you? The first thing I liked about this project that it is a unique opportunity for a non-Indian to play a character with so much depth and importance in a regional film. Ana is a complex character. The message and soul of the film was intriguing and I wanted to explore this aspect of it. You have been actively involved in various aspects of film making. Did it help you perform better as an actor? I believe the most important aspect for an actor is to get in touch with the character. One needs to mould into the character and believe in it. Secondly, you have to trust your director and have faith in his sketch. Prashant and the team have been extremely helpful with all of this. Yes, understanding the nuances of filmmaking helps when it comes to lighting and other effects. How fluent are you with Marathi? My character Ana is from England who comes to stay in Maharashtra. She falls in love and becomes one with the land and culture. My friend Rinki helped me with the language. She literally coached me. The script was in Devnagari so I learnt to write and speak the language. Siddharth Chandekar and Manava Naik helped me with my lines and made me feel comfortable on sets. I insisted on learning the language so that I could get the emotions right. It took me a month to get my dialogues in place.
News.Heading: TR Sahwney Motors opens its seventh showroom in Ghaziabad
News.text: Friends, family and clients of the Sahwney brothers recently got together when TR Sahwney Motors opened its seventh showroom in Ghaziabad. T Hashimoto, executive director (marketing and sales) of Maruti Suzuki India Ltd and RS Kalsi, executive director (domestic sales and marketing) of Maruti Suzuki India Ltd were chief guests on the occasion, and participated in the formal lamp lighting, inaugurating the showroom. Addressing the gathering, Sanjiv Sahwney, the technical director of the company, highlighted the achievements of the group. Speaking on the occasion, CEO of the company, Rajiv Kumar Sahwney, said, "This is our first showroom in Ghaziabad. The overwhelming love and acceptance we received in Delhi has encouraged us to expand our network. Today we have opened three showrooms, one at Rajouri Garden, one at Badli in Delhi and one at Rajendra Nagar in Ghaziabad. We believe that building our clients' trust by adding value to our services has helped us maintain a lifelong relationship with them." Encouraged by the response, the company aims at opening more showrooms in NCR. -
News.Heading: Sairat director's wife to reopen divorce case
News.text: Just a couple of weeks post the release of 'Sairat', director Nagraj Manjule has been caught in the midst of a controversy. The filmmaker is currently the toast of the film industry post the smashing success of the recently released film, but an old legal case has come back to haunt him. According to sources, Nagraj's ex-wife Sunita is planning to reopen the lawsuit that led to their divorce a couple of years ago, with the hope of 'securing justice'. Speaking to us about the same, Sunita's cousin, Sagar Lashkare, informed, "They got married when he was in class XII and for 15 years, my sister was by his side through thick and thin. After turning director, Nagraj hardly ever visited his hometown and whenever he did, he never spoke to her." In 2012, a divorce suit was filed which came through in 2014, according to Lashkare. "Post the decision, he gave an amount of `6-7 lakh to us and had assured that he would give more as and when needed. That never happened. Today, he's a star director, earning in crores but not once did he think about ruining my sister's life. We don't want money or anything else. We only demand justice and that is why we want to reopen the case," added Lashkare. Akash Painter, a social worker from Pune, also tried to settle the matter amicably a few years ago. "When the lady came to us with her complaint, I called up Nagraj and asked him to meet me in Pune to sort out the matter. He agreed but never came. After that the matter went to court," said Painter. We tried contacting Nagraj but he wasn't available for comment till the time of going to press. (Inputs by Shashank.Sane@timesgroup.com) *This is an updated version of the story. News.Heading: Sequels galore to storm Sandalwood screens
News.text: Be it thrillers, romance or drama, Sandalwood viewers are in for a treat, as there are quite a few sequels in the pipeline in Sandalwood. While some of these star the same actors as the originals, others have newer, younger faces in the sequels that are underway. This year already saw Uppi 2, the sequel to director-actor Upendra's earlier self-titled film, albeit with some new faces added to the cast. Among those underway, we have Mungaru Male 2, which has the same hero, but a different director and heroine. Ganesh romances newbie Neha Shetty, with Shashank directing the new film. The 2011 hit Rajdhani, which was one of the early hits in Yash's career, is having a sequel with an all-new cast. Hariprriya is the heroine, opposite Preetham as her hero. Director Suni is currently completing the sequel to his film Simplag Ondu Love Story, which has been titled Simplag Innondu Love Story. The film stars TV actor Praveen and Meghana Gaonkar in lead roles. Kalpana, which was a remake of the Tamil film Kanchana, will have a sequel too. While there was a Muni 3 that was made after Kanchana, we wonder if that will be the subject of Kalpana 2. Also currently in the works is director-actor Kishan's sequel to his C/O Footpath, titled Care of Footpath 2. The film, to be released in Hindi and Telugu as well, has an ensemble cast of many known faces and stars Bollywood director Anees Bazmee and actress Esha Deol. Other sequels that have been announced so far include Ayya 2, Huccha 2 and Dandupalya 2, which have been greenlit quite a while ago, but are still in different stages of production. Both the Ayya and Huccha sequels have younger heroes replacing the original cast. Chiranjeevi Sarja will be seen in Ayya 2, while Dhananjaya was roped in to be in Huccha 2. Among the newer ones that will go on floors, Suri's recently released Manvitha- and Vicky-starrer will have both a part 1 and part 2 releasing, given that the film that hit screens was a part 2 itself. The Sriimurali-starrer Ugramm will have a sequel titled Ugramm Veeram. Certain scenes in KM Chaitanya's Aatagara also suggest that it might have a sequel, but the makers haven't confirmed anything. There has been talk about a sequel to the Yash- and Kriti Kharbanda-starrer-Googly and the Ramya- and Srinagara Kitty-starrer Sanju Weds Geetha, but we haven't heard from the makers after initial speculation and discussions about the projects.

News.Heading: Hyderabad gets a taste of Subramaniam gharana
News.text: All roads led to Shilpakala Vedika on Thursday. You might be sniggering at that cliche but that was the reality, so much that choc-a-block traffic even got the performing artistes of the Times of India Lakshminarayana Global Music Festival a bit delayed. Nevertheless, once the music began all pressures of the outside world were laid to rest as Dr L Subramaniam picked up his bow to play violin and conduct the amalgamation of the seven percussionists from across the country. In the first half of the show, the women of the family took the stage. Bindu's Let there be love and peace... a perfect balm for today's fractured world was followed by Kavita Krishnamurti's, who took to stage amid applause and prayed for musical avenues beyond movies in her life as she sang a bhajan. However, she did perform her iconic film numbers from 1941, a Love Story and Bombay. Then arrived the father and son duo (Dr L Subramaniam and Ambi), who performed in beautiful symphony a composition made to commemorate the 40 years of Indian Independence and performed at the United Nations, New York. But the audiences who were already in the trance had no idea what was going to come their way in the second half, following a small break. What followed next was a energetic second half that began with electrifying guitars for the track Time is right and then the highlight of the evening the percussion symphony. "We are first going to try it on you and see your reaction and decide if we want to play it in other cities," quipped Dr Subramaniam, who walked up and down the stage at complete ease as if the violin was a natural extension of his body and soul. Of course, the mesmerising symphony was received with loud applause Hyderabad had not just liked it but loved it. The final piece had everyone from the Subramaniam family on stage Kavita, Bindu, Ambi and even Dr Sumbramaniam's three-and-half-year-old granddaughter Mahati, who was welcomed on the stage with "awwwws" from the audience. As they sang, together and Subramaniam involved the percussionists on the stage in a playful juglabandi, one could picturise an average day in the Subramaniam household being full of beautiful music and symphony. After taking out time to talk to his fans at the end of the show, Dr Subramaniam, elated by Hyderabad's response, says, "Yea, most people jokingly say we are the Subramaniam gharana." And Hyderabad sure loved being part of the family.

News.Heading: Bobbi Kristina Brown, daughter of Whitney Houston, passes away
News.text: The brief, chaotic life of Bobbi Kristina Brown was never really her own. Born and raised in the shadow of fame and litigation, shattered by the loss of her mother, Whitney Houston, Bobbi Kristina was overwhelmed by the achievements and demons of others before she could begin to figure out who she was. Her demise was the most awful inheritance of all. Bobbi Kristina passed away on Sunday at Peachtree Christian Hospice in Duluth, Georgia, about six months after she was found face-down and unresponsive in a bathtub in the suburban Atlanta townhome she shared with Nick Gordon, the man she called her husband. She was 22-years-old. Bobbi Kristina Brown passed away July, 26 2015, surrounded by her family. She is finally at peace in the arms of God. We want to again thank everyone for their tremendous amount of love and support during these last few months,'' Kristen Foster, a representative for the Houston family said Sunday. For latest Music updates, follow us on Twitter >>>@TOIEntertain For the latest in Music news, like us on Facebook >>>TOIEntertain Police said she was found Jan. 31 in the suburban Atlanta townhome she shared with Gordon. A police report described it as a "drowning.'' READ: No progress in comatose Bobbi Kristina Brown's condition Bobbi Kristina was the only child between Houston and Brown. She was hospitalized for months in Atlanta eventually being placed in hospice care after being found in a manner grimly similar to the way her megastar mother died three years earlier. The police report called it a "drowning,'' and Gordon said at the time it seemed she wasn't breathing and lacked a pulse before help arrived. Brown _ the sole heir of her mother's estate _ did have dreams. She identified herself on Twitter as "Daughter of Queen WH,'' "Entertainer/Actress'' with William Morris & Co., and "LAST of a dying breed.'' She told Oprah shortly after her mother's death in 2012 that she wanted to carry on her mother's legacy by singing, acting and dancing. But her career never took off. Actor and producer Tyler Perry said she had a future as an actress after her debut on his TV show "For Better or Worse'' in 2012, but she only appeared in one episode. Aside from two ill-fated reality TV shows and the occasional paparazzi video, her image mostly showed up in the "selfies'' she posted online. She attended award shows and appeared on red carpets with her mother and father. She performed a duet on TV with her mother in 2009, singing "My Love Is Your Love'' in New York's Central Park. She became social media sensation, sending more than 11,000 tweets and attracting 164,000 followers. But Whitney Houston, known as "America's Sweetheart,'' was an impossible act to follow. The late singer sold more than 50 million records in the United States alone during her career. Her voice, an ideal blend of power, grace and beauty, made classics out of songs like "Saving All My Love For You,'' "I Will Always Love You'' and "The Greatest Love of All.'' She earned six Grammys and starred in the films "The Bodyguard'' and "The Preacher's Wife.'' Bobby Brown had a bad-boy image but also became a huge star, selling platinum records with New Edition and going solo before drugs and legal woes derailed his career. Bobbi Kristina appeared alongside both parents in 2005 on the Bravo reality show "Being Bobby Brown,'' which captured her parents fighting, swearing and appearing in court. The Hollywood Reporter said it revealed that Brown was "even more vulgar than the tabloids suggest,'' and managed "to rob Houston of any last shreds of dignity.'' Years earlier, as Houston was preparing to give birth to Bobbi Kristina, she expressly left Bobby Brown out of her will, putting everything in a trust "for the benefit of her children and more remote descendants,'' according to the Houstons' 2012 petition. For more interesting Music news and pictures, follow us on Pinterest>>> timesofindia For latest Music updates, follow us on G+ >>> The Times of India Entertainment After their divorce in 2007, Houston kept custody of Bobbi Kristina and raised her alongside Gordon, an orphan three years older than her daughter. Houston brought Gordon into her family, and while she never formally adopted him or included him in the will, both teenagers called her "mom.'' The threesome's tight bond was shattered when Houston's assistant found the singer's lifeless body face-down in a foot of water in her bathtub at the Beverly Hills Hotel just before the Grammy Awards in 2012. Authorities found prescription drugs in the suite, and evidence of heart disease and cocaine in her body, but determined that it was an accidental drowning. Bobbi Kristina, then 18, was at the hotel and became so hysterical she had to be hospitalized. "She wasn't only a mother, she was a best friend,'' she told Oprah Winfrey. She and Gordon then went public with their romance, posting defiant messages online after the tabloids accused them of incest. The Houstons tolerated their relationship, appearing with them on television that year in Lifetime's reality show "The Houstons: On Our Own.'' But in one telling episode, the late singer's relatives lectured the pair about drinking after they show up in an obviously altered state, and accuse Gordon of failing to take care of the grieving girl. Relations between Gordon and some other relatives continued to sour over the past year after Bobbi Kristina was hospitalized. A protective order barred him from being within 200 feet of Pat Houston, Bobbi Kristina's aunt. A feud erupted over whether Gordon could visit Bobbi Kristina while she stayed in the hospital. On June 24, Bobbi Kristina's court-appointed representative sued Gordon, accusing him of misrepresenting his relationship with Bobbi Kristina. The complaint accused him of being violent toward her and taking more than $11,000 from her account while she was in a medically induced coma after the Jan. 31 tragedy. The lawsuit accused Gordon of assault, battery, intentional infliction of emotional distress, unjust enrichment and conversion. Fulton County District Attorney Paul Howard said he and his office are interested in reviewing the investigative file to determine whether any charges will be filed. Also on June 24, Pat Houston said Bobbi Kristina had been placed in hospice care. Bobbi Kristina was fabulously wealthy for a teenager, but her money was in a spendthrift trust, designed to keep creditors and predators from taking advantage of people who can't manage their money. Bobbi Kristina's grandmother, Cissy Houston, and aunt, Pat Houston, eventually took over control of the trust and then took Bobbi Kristina to court to protect the estate. The Houstons called Bobbi Kristina "a highly visible target for those who would exercise undue influence over her inheritance and/or seek to benefit from (her) resources and celebrity,'' and urged a judge to delay how quickly she could control the money. Bobbi Kristina agreed to the delay, and the judge granted their request to seal the case. The size of Houston's estate is a privately held secret. In May, a judge appointed Bobby Brown and Pat Houston as co-guardians of Bobbi Kristina, giving them joint responsibility in decisions related to her care and medical needs. Lawyer Bedelia Hargrove was appointed conservator to oversee Bobbi Kristina's assets, including her rights and legal claims. Houston signed a $100 million record deal in 2001, but failed to deliver, and lost two homes to foreclosure toward the end of her life. But her early death revived a hunger for her music, and her name and likeness generated revenue that became part of Bobbi Kristina's inheritance. By January 2014, the young couple who grew up as brother and sister were sharing a townhome in Roswell, Georgia, and calling themselves husband and wife. They posted images of their hands wearing wedding rings, with the caption "(hash)HappilyMarried. So (hash)InLove. If you didn't get it the first time that is.'' They got identical "WH'' tattoos with flying doves on their wrists, and Gordon added a large portrait of Houston's face on his arm. Their marriage announcement troubled Pat Houston, who obtained a restraining order against Gordon two months later. "Damn, lol, it's incredible how the world will judge you 4ANY&EVERYthing,'' Bobbi Kristina tweeted at the time. By last September, Pat Houston said she was "very proud of Krissy.'' "Young people today are up against so much with social media and everything else that presents itself to them,'' Pat Houston told The Associated Press. "We try to be there for her, just to try to guide and direct her.'' Judging from her postings online, Bobbi Kristina was focused on the approaching anniversary of her mother's death. In one of her last tweets, she said, "Littlelady&yourgrowing young man (at)nickdgordon miss you mommy ..:') SOmuch.. loving you more every sec. (hash)Anniversary!'' News.Heading: Actor Mahesh Babu adopts Siddapuram village of backward Mahbubnagar
News.text: Tollywood's big hero Mahesh Babu has adopted a Telangana village to participate in its development. He has decided to adopt Siddhapuram village of Kottur mandal in backward Mahbubnagar district. READ: Mahesh Babu gifts Audi A6 to Srimanthudu director Mahesh Babu said he decided on the village 'after much thought' discussing it with IT minister K T Rama Rao. "After much thought, KTR garu and myself have chosen to adopt Siddhapuram village of Kottur mandal in Mahbubnagar district. Looking forward to a constructive and meaningful journey ahead," he said on his Twitter. The star adopting a village for its development has been on the cards for now. Actor Prakash Raj also recently adopted a village in Mahbubnagar district. However, Mahesh Babu earlier had also adopted a village in Andhra Pradesh. He adopted Burripalem village in Guntur districts. While the local authorities will help in drawing up plans for the overall development of the village, the funding will have to be provided by the star. This is an initiative of both the Telangana and AP governments which want prominent people to adopt villages and change their complete face in order to provide them better facilities.
News.Heading: Income tax department raids Tamil film actor Vijay and Nayantara's house
News.text: CHENNAI: Income Tax officials raided the premises of actors Vijay, Nayantara and Samantha, and producers and financiers of the Tamil movie "Puli" on Wednesday morning in connection with alleged tax evasion. Sources said IT sleuths were conducting raids on 35 premises in Chennai, Madurai, Kochi, Thiruvananthapuram and Hyderabad from 7am onwards. Raids were going on at Vijay's resort and residence, Nayantara's residence and Samantha's residence and Puli producers' Shibu Thameens and PT Selvakumar premises. Raids were also being held on the premises of film financiers Madurai Anbu and Ramesh. They also raided the residence and office of film producer and distributor Kalaipuli Thanu. Nayantara is not part of the cast of the Vijay-starrer "Puli." The movie, directed by Chimbu Devan, is slated for release on Thursday. It was not confirmed if raids were being held on the premises of the film director.
News.Heading: Dhyan stuns in his bearded avatar
News.text: Beards are in vogue in Mollywood! After Nivin Pauly and Dulquer Salmaan took the industry by storm last year with their rugged looks in 'Premam' and 'Charlie' respectively, it's now Dhyan Sreenivasan's turn. From the chocolate boy image to the stubble avatar, the 'Adi Kapiyare Kootamani' actor has undergone a drastic makeover for his upcoming movie 'Ore Mugham'. The snaps of the actor sporting a thick beard and moustache with a brooding countenance have already gone viral. The film's director Sajith Jagadnandan tells us the story is set in two timelines. "Dhyan will be seen in two different getups. His campus life is set in the 80s and that's when he will be sporting the gruff avatar with the beard. For the latter portions set in the current era, he will have a totally different appearance," he says. Dhyan plays Zacharias Pothen in the film. "He's a campus leader of sorts, who has the final say in whatever happens in the college. His character also has a grey shade and hence the rugged look," explains Sajith. The movie centres on the life of four friends - played by Dhyan, Aju Varghese, Prayaga Martin and Gayathri Suresh. Amala Paul will also be seen in a pivotal role in the movie.
News.Heading: Shubra Aiyappa at a cocktail party at Sheraton Grand in Bengaluru
News.text: Bengaluru's swish set got to check out interesting fashion over canapes and special concoctions at a cocktail party organized by Jyotiee Balani, beverage enthusiast and food writer co-hosted by Sheraton Grand Bangalore Hotel at Brigade Gateway at their lounge Durbar. Spotted at the event were actresses Shubra Aiyappa and Tina Ponnappa, along with some of the party regulars.
News.Heading: Good content is important for audience now: Naishadh Purani
News.text: Naishadh Purani, the director of much talked about play Taap is taking life easy and enjoying himself after the successful staging of this play. The play that was staged at Natrani was quite a talked about. When we asked Naishadh about his experience with the play, he shares, "When I was in the process of thinking about the subject of the play, I was in two minds whether to make one on serious-intense topic or to come up with a comedy one. Ultimately, I chose this topic of exploitation of women in different social circles as well as age groups. It is a burning issue and to deal with this play carefully was much needed." He goes on to add, "I'm happy with the feedback I have received. People were convinced with the idea." Naishadh is also brainstorming currently for his next theatre work. But usually most Gujarati audience prefer comedy as a genre when it comes to theatre. What does Naishadh think about it? "Commercially, people still opt for a comedy play in Gujarati. But, now I strongly feel any theatre work which has a good content and execution is accepted by audience. Also, social networking has been a boon for all the artists like us as we can get better understanding and involvement from audience." In the meanwhile, team Taap is all set to travel across country for more shows.
News.Heading: Manju Warrier and Ranjith at a book launch in Kochi
News.text: Actress Manju Warrier and Ranjith were spotted at a book launch event in Kochi recently.
News.Heading: Bhale Bhale Magadivoi brought Lavanya tears of joy
News.text: Lavanya Tripathi just can't seem to stop herself from breaking into a guffaw when talking about her upcoming rom-com Bhale Bhale Magadivoi. "This is my first romantic comedy and I've never had as much fun as I did on the sets of this film. In fact, I had tears of joy just listening to director Maruthi narrate the script. I was literally rolling on the floor laughing," says a visibly excited Lavanya. Admittedly, her co-star Nani and director Maruthi would constantly tell Lavanya to stop laughing. "Whenever a scene was discussed or being shot, I used to imagine how it would translate on to the screen and a movie would run in front of my eyes and I would immediately burst out laughing. Nani and Maruthi would say, 'You are giving us over confidence. You laugh on everything and we think we are doing it so well. Hopefully it's not just you who finds it funny.' But my laughter was genuine and I think it will be like that for everyone who watches it," shared Lavanya, adding "I am very happy with the way it has shaped up. So my excitement is pretty obvious." The actress fondly recalls her experience of working with Nani, with whom she is teaming up with for the first time, saying, "I always wanted to work with Nani. So this opportunity was a great one. Despite being around for over six years now, it's incredible how he still is like a newcomer on the sets. Nani is a consummate actor and is very keen about his work and puts in extra effort into every single shot. He is very spontaneous too," says the actress who learnt Kuchipudi for this film. Lavanya plays a classical dancer in the movie, but her favourite song though is a beach song, Hello Hello. "We were shooting for it and the same day it started raining. It was apparently the first rain of Goa. I just love rain and the choreographer asked me to just go and enjoy myself and do what I like. I had a really fun time. Nani was forced to join me because I couldn't be in the shot all alone!" recalls Lavanya who happened to run into a childhood friend when shooting in Goa. "She was my friend in college and it was such a proud moment for her to see me working. She had seen me as a kid and now like this shooting and all. It was overwhelming," recalls Lavanya, who confesses to missing shooting for the film. "Every moment on the sets was so much fun. Frankly, I miss the whole crew because we had become friends. It is a thing which happens after every film but this time the film being a funny one, we laughed so often that the memories will remain sweet ones," she says signing off. Bhale Bhale Magadivoi, produced by Bunny Vas and presented by Allu Aravind under Geetha Arts, UV Creations banner, is releasing on Sep 4.
News.Heading: Mohanlal skips blog due to world trip
News.text: Superstar Mohanlal has given his monthly blog a miss due to his ongoing vacation with family. The actor took to his social networking page to convey the news to his fans, with a pic of him in China. "I'm in the midst of world trip, and not in a position to pen my thoughts. I am taking a break this month. Will catch you all for sure here in this space, next month," he posted, along with a pic of his wife and friends. Mohanlal has religiously posted a blog on the 21st of every month and covered several issues including the JNU student activism and Kerala stray dog menace.
News.Heading: Sunburn Reload: EDM Fest floors Barodians!
News.text: DJ Indra J, Vadodara's most well-known DJ, has often said that Vadodara is ahead of other cities in Gujarat when it comes to reception towards electronic dance music (EDM). And it was pretty evident when Sunburn Reload, a mini version of the immensely popular Sunburn music festival held in Goa, was held at Sevasi recently. Barodians had been waiting for this event with bated breath and the wait proved to be worth it. Indra J, Anish Sood and Piyush Bhatnagar (who is popularly known as Sound Avtar), the three artists for the evening, were in fine form throughout the evening and the young crowd had a fantastic experience.
News.Heading: Ladies have a stylish day out at Westin, Hyderabad
News.text: New Year certainly seems to have brought out the best in our party circuit. At a recent shindig hosted by Shail and Deepa Gupta, giggles and kisses in the air did the rounds, as good music kept the feel-good atmosphere going. It was a perfect evening of music, song and dance that saw ladies dressed in their party best. The P3Ps were also seen shaking a leg and crooning during karaoke time. A time well spent, we say!
News.Heading: Poonam Dubey to star in Hum Hai Jodi No. 1
News.text: Poonam Dubey, the latest hot sensation in Bhojpuri cinema, is currently busy shooting Hum Hai Jodi No. 1 in Lucknow. Along with her, the film also stars Ravi Kishan and Rani Chatterjee. In a recent interview, she said that if the script is impressive, she has no problems with showing skin show. Her body features and looks have acquired a special place in the audience's hearts. In the films she has acted so far, her hot and sexy avatar has managed to rule hearts. Something similar is expected from her in Hum Hai Jodi No. 1.
